thread.title: CFPB Sends Industry Letter on TRID
thread.title_full: CFPB Sends Industry Letter on TRID

author: MoFo Reenforcement
title: CFPB Sends Industry Letter on TRID
text:
CFPB Sends Industry Letter on TRID more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=3084180c-0e19-4461-a51d-8d2b23f9c47c" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"></iframe> 
On October 1, regulators including the CFPB sent a letter to mortgage industry trade groups regarding TRID. The letter states that: 
“During initial examinations for compliance with the rule, the Bureau’s examiners will evaluate an institution’s compliance management system and overall efforts to come into compliance, recognizing the scope and scale of changes necessary for each supervised institution to achieve effective compliance. Examiners will expect supervised entities to make good faith efforts to comply with the rule’s requirements in a timely manner. Specifically, examiners will consider: the institution’s implementation plan , including actions taken to update policies, procedures, and processes; its training of appropriate staff; and, its handling of early technical problems or other implementation challenges.” (emphasis added) 
Click here to read the full letter.
